channel.title: Stream Isolation Functional?
channel.description:
Hello, On the new Whonix 14, the Whonix check doesn't automatically start, so I am unsure if I am connected to Tor. I find myself running the check every time I logon. Is this normal?
Also, with Whonix 13, after the check would run, it would pop up with a window saying "Stream Isolation Functional" and show the two IP addresses. Is this no longer happening? I liked having that pop up as an assurance. Is it safe to assume it's functional, or is there a way I can double check?
Thanks!

item.title: Stream Isolation Functional?
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi David888

These changes were made for Whonix 14. What you are see is expected behavior.

https://github.com/Whonix/whonixcheck/commit/58c66f5700f0e90301a9e4d6042f573371671edd

David888:

Is it safe to assume it’s functional, or is there a way I can double check?

Whonix uses stream isolation for all applications listed here unless you disable it.

Whonix

Stream Isolation

Prevent Identity Correlation through Circuit Sharing by using Tor Stream Isolation

Read full topic

item.title: Stream Isolation Functional?
item.dc:creator: David888
item.description:
Hello, On the new Whonix 14, the Whonix check doesn’t automatically start, so I am unsure if I am connected to Tor. I find myself running the check every time I logon. Is this normal?

Also, with Whonix 13, after the check would run, it would pop up with a window saying “Stream Isolation Functional” and show the two IP addresses. Is this no longer happening? I liked having that pop up as an assurance. Is it safe to assume it’s functional, or is there a way I can double check?
